composition.cmindex¶

This module contains built-in complex indices of refraction typically used for astrophysical dust.

API for CmIndex classes¶

class CmIndex (object)

ATTRIBUTES
cmtype : string (‘Drude’, ‘Graphite’, or ‘Silicate’)
citation : A string containing citation to original source of optical constants
rp : either a function or scipy.interp1d object that can called,
e.g. rp(E) where E is in [keV]
ip : same as above, ip(E) where E is in [keV]

Class Library¶

class astrodust.distlib.composition.cmindex.CmDrude(rho=3.0)¶
ATTRIBUTES
cmtype : ‘Drude’
rho : grain density [g cm^-3]
citation : A string containing citation to original work

** FUNCTIONS**
rp(E) : real part of complex index of refraction [E in keV]
ip(E) : imaginary part of complex index of refraction [always 0.0]
class astrodust.distlib.composition.cmindex.CmGraphite(size='big', orient='perp')¶
ATTRIBUTES
cmtype : ‘Graphite’
size : ‘big’ or ‘small’
orient : ‘perp’ or ‘para’
citation : A string containing citation to original work
rp(E) : scipy.interp1d object
ip(E) : scipy.interp1d object [E in keV]
class astrodust.distlib.composition.cmindex.CmSilicate¶
ATTRIBUTES
cmtype : ‘Silicate’
citation : A string containing citation to the original work
rp(E) : scipy.interp1d object
ip(E) : scipy.interp1d object [E in keV]

Functions¶

astrodust.distlib.composition.cmindex.getCM(E, model=<astrodust.distlib.composition.cmindex.CmDrude object>)¶
INPUTS
E : scalar or np.array [keV]
model : any Cm-type object

RETURNS
Complex index of refraction : scalar or np.array of dtype=’complex’
